 8034: otp_13939(doc) ->
 8035:     ["Check that writing to a remotely closed socket doesn't block forever "
 8036:      "when exit_on_close is false."];
 8037: otp_13939(suite) ->
 8038:     [];
 8039: otp_13939(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8040:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_opt(
 8041:         fun() ->
 8042:             {ok, Listener} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{exit_on_close, false}]),
 8043:             {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listener),
 8044: 
 8045:             spawn_link(
 8046:                 fun() ->
 8047:                     {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, "localhost", Port,
 8048:                         [{active, false}]),
 8049:                     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client)
 8050:                 end),
 8051: 
 8052:             {ok, Accepted} = gen_tcp:accept(Listener),
 8053: 
 8054:             ok = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8055: 
 8056:             %% The bug surfaces when there's a delay between the send
 8057:             %% operations; inet:getstat is a red herring.
 8058:             timer:sleep(100),
 8059: 
 8060:             {error, Code} = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8061:             ct:pal("gen_tcp:send returned ~p~n", [Code])
 8062:         end, [link, monitor]),
 8063: 
 8064:     receive
 8065:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} ->
 8066:             ok
 8067:     after 1000 ->
 8068:         demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
 8069:         exit(Pid, normal),
 8070:         ct:fail("Server process blocked on send.")
 8071:     end.
 8072: 
 8073: 
 8074: %% No point in running this as the test case with inet_backend = socket
 8075: %% as it tests a bug in the inet driver that cannot reproduced with
 8076: %% inet_backend = socket.
 8077: otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8078:     Cond = fun() ->
 8079: 		   case os:type() of
 8080: 		       {win32,_} ->
 8081: 			   %% Even if we set sndbuf and recbuf to small sizes
 8082: 			   %% Windows either happily accepts to send GBytes of
 8083: 			   %% data in no time, so the second send below that
 8084: 			   %% is supposed to time out just succeeds, or the 
 8085: 			   %% first send that is supposed to fill the inet_drv
 8086: 			   %% I/O queue and start waiting for when more data
 8087: 			   %% can be sent instead sends all data but suffers
 8088: 			   %% a send failure that closes the socket.
 8089: 			   {skip, backpressure_broken_on_win32};
 8090: 		       _ ->
 8091: 			   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8092: 			       true ->
 8093: 				   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
 8094: 			       false ->
 8095: 				   ok
 8096: 			   end
 8097: 		   end
 8098: 	   end,
 8099:     TC = fun() -> do_otp_12242(Config) end,
 8100:     ?TC_TRY(otp_12242, Cond, TC).
 8101: 
 8102: do_otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8103:     %% Find the IPv4 address of an up and running interface
 8104:     %% that is not loopback nor pointtopoint
 8105:     {ok, IFList} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 8106:     ?P("IFList "
 8107:        "~n      ~p", [IFList]),
 8108:     case
 8109: 	lists:flatten(
 8110: 	  [lists:filtermap(
 8111: 	     fun ({addr, Addr}) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8112: 		     {true, Addr};
 8113: 		 (_) ->
 8114: 		     false
 8115: 	     end, Opts)
 8116: 	   || {_,Opts} <- IFList,
 8117: 	      case lists:keyfind(flags, 1, Opts) of
 8118: 		  {_,Flags} ->
 8119: 		      lists:member(up, Flags)
 8120: 			  andalso
 8121: 			  lists:member(running, Flags)
 8122: 			  andalso
 8123: 			  not lists:member(loopback, Flags)
 8124: 			  andalso
 8125: 			  not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags);
 8126: 		  false ->
 8127: 		      false
 8128: 	      end])
 8129:     of
 8130: 	[Addr|_] ->
 8131: 	    otp_12242(Config, Addr);
 8132: 	Other ->
 8133: 	    ?SKIPT({no_external_address, Other})
 8134:     end.
 8135: 
 8136: %%
 8137: otp_12242(Config, Addr) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8138:     ct:timetrap(30000),
 8139:     ?P("Using address ~p", [Addr]),
 8140:     Bufsize  = 16 * 1024,
 8141:     Datasize = 128 * 1024 * 1024, % At least 1 s on GBit interface
 8142:     Blob     = binary:copy(<<$x>>, Datasize),
 8143:     LOpts =
 8144:         [{backlog,   4},
 8145: 	 {reuseaddr, true},
 8146: 	 {ip,        Addr},
 8147:          binary,
 8148: 	 {active,    false},
 8149:          {recbuf,    Bufsize},
 8150: 	 {sndbuf,    Bufsize},
 8151: 	 {buffer,    Bufsize}],
 8152:     COpts =
 8153:         [binary,
 8154: 	 {active,       false},
 8155: 	 {ip,           Addr},
 8156:          {linger,       {true, 1}}, % 1 s
 8157:          {send_timeout, 500},
 8158:          {recbuf,       Bufsize},
 8159: 	 {sndbuf,       Bufsize},
 8160: 	 {buffer,       Bufsize}],
 8161:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 8162:     {ok, ListenerNode} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir),
 8163:     Tester = self(),
 8164:     ?P("create listener"),
 8165:     {Listener, ListenerMRef} =
 8166:         spawn_opt(
 8167:           ListenerNode,
 8168:           fun () ->
 8169: 		  ?P("create listen socket"),
 8170:                   {ok,L}     = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, LOpts),
 8171:                   {ok,LPort} = inet:port(L),
 8172: 		  ?P("inform tester about port number: ~w", [LPort]),
 8173:                   Tester ! {self(), port, LPort},
 8174: 		  ?P("try accept"),
 8175:                   {ok, A}    = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8176: 		  ?P("accepted - close listen socket"),
 8177:                   ok         = gen_tcp:close(L),
 8178: 		  ?P("await close order"),
 8179:                   receive
 8180:                       {Tester, stop} ->
 8181: 			  ?P("close order received - close accepted socket"),
 8182:                           ok = gen_tcp:close(A)
 8183:                   end
 8184:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8185:     ?P("await listen port"),
 8186:     LPort = receive {Listener,port,P} -> P end,
 8187:     ?P("try connect to ~w", [LPort]),
 8188:     {ok,C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, LPort, COpts, infinity),
 8189:     ?P("connected - get buffers"),
 8190:     {ok, ReadCOpts} = inet:getopts(C, [recbuf,sndbuf,buffer]),
 8191:     ?P("connected sockets buffers:"
 8192:        "~n      ~p", [ReadCOpts]),
 8193: 
 8194:     otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize),
 8195: 
 8196:     ?P("send listener stop"),
 8197:     Listener ! {Tester, stop},
 8198:     ?P("await listener termination"),
 8199:     wait(ListenerMRef),
 8200:     ?P("stop listener node"),
 8201:     ?STOP_NODE(ListenerNode),
 8202:     ?P("done"),
 8203:     ok.
 8204:     
 8205: 
 8206: otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8207:     %% Fill the buffers
 8208:     ?P("sending ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8209:     case gen_tcp:send(C, Blob) of
 8210:         ok ->
 8211:             ?P("sent ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8212:             otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize);
 8213:         {error, {timeout, _RestData}} ->
 8214:             %% We filled the buffers and timed out;
 8215:             %% this is probably the socket backend - give up.
 8216:             ok;
 8217:         {error, timeout} ->
 8218:             %% The same as the previous clause
 8219:             ok
 8220:     end,
 8221:     _ = gen_tcp:close(C),
 8222:     ok.
 8223: 
 8224: otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8225:     %% Try to ensure that the close call is in progress
 8226:     %% before the owner proceeds with sending
 8227:     CloserMRef = otp_12242_closer(C),
 8228:     
 8229:     ?P("await tref"),
 8230:     receive
 8231:         {tref,Tref} ->
 8232: 	    ?P("tref received - now await trigger timeout"),
 8233:             receive {timeout,Tref,_} -> ok end,
 8234:             ?P("trigger timeout received - try send ~p bytes again",
 8235: 	       [Datasize]),
 8236:             %% Now should the close be in progress...
 8237:             %% All buffers are full, remote end is not reading,
 8238:             %% and the send timeout is 1 s so this will timeout:
 8239:             {error, timeout} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8240:             ?P("expected timeout - update send_timeout (to 10000)"),
 8241:             ok = inet:setopts(C, [{send_timeout, 10000}]),
 8242:             %% There is a hidden timeout here.  Port close is sampled
 8243:             %% every 5 s by prim_inet:send_recv_reply.
 8244:             %% Linger is 3 s so the Closer will finish this send:
 8245:             ?P("try send ~p bytes - expect error (closed)", [Datasize]),
 8246:             {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8247:             ?P("await closer termination"),
 8248:             normal = wait(CloserMRef),
 8249:             ok
 8250:     end.
 8251: 
 8252: otp_12242_closer(C) ->
 8253:     Owner = self(),
 8254:     {_Closer, CloserMref} =
 8255:         spawn_opt(
 8256:           fun () ->
 8257:                   ?P("[closer] starting"),
 8258:                   Owner ! {tref, erlang:start_timer(50, Owner, closing)},
 8259:                   ?P("[closer] calling gen_tcp:close(C)"),
 8260:                   try gen_tcp:close(C) of
 8261:                       Result ->
 8262:                           ?P("[closer] gen_tcp:close(C) -> ~p", [Result]),
 8263:                           ok = Result
 8264:                   catch
 8265:                       Class:Reason:Stacktrace ->
 8266:                           ?P("[closer] caught gen_tcp:close(C):"
 8267: 			     "~n      Error Class:  ~p"
 8268: 			     "~n      Error:        ~p"
 8269: 			     "~n      Stack trace:  ~p",
 8270:                             [Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
 8271:                           erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
 8272:                   end
 8273:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8274:     CloserMref.
 8275: 
 8276: 
 8277: wait(Mref) ->
 8278:     receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} -> Reason end.
 8279: 
 8280: %% OTP-15536
 8281: %% Test that send error works correctly for delay_send
 8282: delay_send_error(Config) ->
 8283:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 8284:     {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 8285:     {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip,        Addr},
 8286:                                      {reuseaddr, true},
 8287:                                      {packet,    1},
 8288:                                      {active,    false}]),
 8289:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(L),
 8290: 
 8291:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, false),
 8292:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, true),
 8293:     ?P("close listen socket"),
 8294:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 8295: 
 8296: delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, Active) ->
 8297:     ?P("try connect - with delay_send:true active:~p",[Active]),
 8298:     {ok, C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 8299:                        [{ip,         Addr},
 8300:                         {packet,     1},
 8301:                         {active,     Active},
 8302:                         {delay_send, true}]),
 8303:     ?P("try accept"),
 8304:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8305:     %% Do a couple of sends first to see that it works
 8306:     ?P("send data"),
 8307:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8308:     ?P("send data"),
 8309:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8310:     ?P("send data"),
 8311:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8312:     %% Close the receiver
 8313:     ?P("close receiver (accepted socket)"),
 8314:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(C, write),
 8315:     %%
 8316:     ?P("send data"),
 8317:     case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8318:         ok ->
 8319:             ?P("send data"),
 8320:             case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8321:                 ok ->
 8322:                     delay_send_error2(C);
 8323:                 {error, closed} ->
 8324:                     ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8325:                     ok
 8326:             end;
 8327: 
 8328:         {error, closed} ->
 8329:             ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8330:             ok;
 8331: 
 8332:         {error, #{info := eshutdown = R}} ->
 8333:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8334:             ok;
 8335:         {error, eshutdown = R} ->
 8336:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8337:             ok
 8338:     end,
 8339:     ?P("close accepted socket"),
 8340:     ok = gen_tcp:close(A),
 8341:     ?P("close connected socket"),
 8342:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C).
 8343: 
 8344: 
 8345: delay_send_error2(Sock) ->
 8346:     delay_send_error2(Sock, 3).
 8347: 
 8348: delay_send_error2(Sock, 0) ->
 8349:     gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 8350:     ct:fail("Unexpected send success");
 8351: delay_send_error2(Sock, N) ->
 8352:     %% Sleep in order for delay_send to have time to trigger
 8353:     %% This used to result in a double free
 8354:     timer:sleep(1000),
 8355:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, "hello") of
 8356:         ok ->
 8357:             delay_send_error2(Sock, N-1);
 8358:         {error, closed} ->
 8359:             ?P("closed (expected, ~w)", [N]),
 8360:             ok;
 8361:         {error, Reason} ->
 8362:             ct:fail(?F("Unexpected send error: ~p", [Reason]))
 8363:     end.

 8370: 
 8371: -define(MAX_WORKERS, 30).
 8372: 
 8373: %% 30-second test for gen_tcp in {active, N} mode,
 8374: %% ensuring it does not get stuck.
 8375: %% Verifies that erl_check_io properly handles extra EPOLLIN signals.
 8376: %% We do not bother with this test case on inet_backend = socket
 8377: %% since the test is about the inet-driver!
 8378: bidirectional_traffic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8379:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 8380:     Cond = fun() ->
 8381: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8382: 		       true ->
 8383: 			   {skip, "Inet driver specific test"};
 8384: 		       false ->
 8385: 			   ok
 8386: 		   end
 8387: 	   end,
 8388:     Pre  = fun() ->
 8389: 		   Addr =
 8390: 		       case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8391: 			   {ok, A} ->
 8392: 			       A;
 8393: 			   {error, Reason} ->
 8394: 			       ?SKIPT({skip, Reason})
 8395: 		       end,
 8396:                    NumOnlineScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 8397:                    NumWorkers0     = NumOnlineScheds * 2,
 8398:                    {NumWorkers, ActiveN} =
 8399:                        if
 8400:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 10) ->
 8401:                                {NumWorkers0, 20};
 8402:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 20) ->
 8403:                                {NumWorkers0, 18};
 8404:                            (NumWorkers0 =< ?MAX_WORKERS) ->
 8405:                                {NumWorkers0, 15};
 8406:                            true ->
 8407:                                {?MAX_WORKERS, 15}
 8408:                        end,
 8409:                    ?P("pre ->"
 8410:                       "~n   Number Of Online Schedulers: ~w"
 8411:                       "~n   =>"
 8412:                       "~n      Use workers: ~w"
 8413:                       "~n      ActiveN:     ~w",
 8414:                       [NumOnlineScheds, NumWorkers, ActiveN]),
 8415:                    Payload = bdt_payload(32),
 8416:                    {ok, LSock} = ?LISTEN(Config,
 8417:                                          0,
 8418:                                          [binary,
 8419:                                           {ip,        Addr},
 8420: 					  {packet,    0},
 8421:                                           {active,    false},
 8422:                                           {reuseaddr, true}]),
 8423:                    %% get all sockets to know failing ends
 8424:                    ?P("pre -> listen socket created: "
 8425:                       "~n      ~p", [LSock]),
 8426:                    #{lsock       => LSock,
 8427: 		     addr        => Addr,
 8428:                      num_workers => NumWorkers,
 8429:                      payload     => Payload,
 8430:                      %% The point of this is to make it "easy" to 
 8431:                      %% "configure" this value...
 8432:                      active_n    => ActiveN}
 8433:            end,
 8434:     Case = fun(Info) -> do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, Info) end,
 8435:     Post = fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8436:                    ?P("post -> close listen socket"),
 8437:                    (catch gen_tcp:close(LSock))
 8438:            end,
 8439:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8440:             Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 8441: 
 8442: bdt_payload(N) ->
 8443:     rand:bytes(N).
 8444:     
 8445: 
 8446: do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, #{lsock       := LSock,
 8447:                                    num_workers := NumWorkers} = Info) ->
 8448:     ?P("case -> begin"),
 8449:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(LSock),
 8450:     ?P("case -> listen socket port number ~w", [Port]),
 8451:     Control = self(),
 8452:     ?P("case -> create ~w receivers", [NumWorkers]),
 8453:     Receivers = [spawn_link(fun () -> 
 8454: 				    exchange(Config,
 8455:                                              Info#{port => Port,
 8456:                                                    ctrl => Control})
 8457: 			    end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, NumWorkers)],
 8458:     ?P("case -> await the result"),
 8459:     %% Should we not collect as many as possible?
 8460:     %% To see how many as issues?
 8461:     Result =
 8462: 	%% If any of the receivers report, we have an error
 8463:         receive
 8464:             {timeout, Socket, Total} ->
 8465:                 ?P("case -> timeout msg for ~p: received ~w", [Socket, Total]),
 8466:                 throw({fail, {timeout, Socket, Total}});
 8467: 	    {error, Socket, Reason} ->
 8468:                 ?P("case -> error msg for ~p: ~p", [Socket, Reason]),
 8469:                 throw({fail, {error, Socket, Reason}})
 8470:         after 30000 ->
 8471:                 %% if it does not fail in 30 seconds, it most likely works
 8472:                 ?P("case -> timeout => success"),
 8473:                 ok
 8474:         end,
 8475:     ?P("case -> ensure all receivers terminated"),
 8476:     %% [begin unlink(Rec), exit(Rec, kill) end || Rec <- Receivers],
 8477:     bt_terminate_receivers(Receivers),
 8478:     ?P("case -> done"),
 8479:     Result.
 8480: 
 8481: %% The point of this (function) is so that the 'receivers' should
 8482: %% get a chance to "tell us" what they are up to...
 8483: bt_terminate_receivers(Recvs) ->
 8484:     bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs),
 8485:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8486:     bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs).
 8487: 
 8488: bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs) ->
 8489:     [begin
 8490:          unlink(Recv),
 8491:          Recv ! terminate
 8492:      end || Recv <- Recvs].
 8493: 
 8494: bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs) ->
 8495:     [exit(Recv, kill) || Recv <- Recvs].
 8496:     
 8497: exchange(Config, #{lsock    := LSock,
 8498: 		   addr     := Addr,
 8499:                    port     := Port, 
 8500:                    payload  := Payload,
 8501:                    ctrl     := Control,
 8502:                    active_n := ActiveN}) ->
 8503:     %% spin up client
 8504:     _ClntRcv = spawn_link(
 8505:         fun () ->
 8506:                 ?P("exchange:client -> connect"),
 8507:                 {ok, Client} =
 8508:                     ?CONNECT(Config,
 8509: 			     Addr,
 8510: 			     Port,
 8511: 			     [binary,
 8512: 			      {ip, Addr}, {packet, 0}, {active, ActiveN}]),
 8513:                 ?P("exchange:client -> connected: ~p"
 8514:                    "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8515:                    "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8516:                    [Client,
 8517:                     oki(inet:peername(Client)), oki(inet:sockname(Client))]),
 8518:                 put(role, connected),
 8519:                 send_recv_loop(Client, Payload, Control, ActiveN)
 8520:         end),
 8521:     ?P("exchange -> accept"),
 8522:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 8523:     ?P("exchange -> accepted: ~p"
 8524:        "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8525:        "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8526:        [Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket))]),
 8527:     %% sending process
 8528:     put(role, accepted),
 8529:     send_recv_loop(Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN).
 8530: 
 8531: send_recv_loop(Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8532:     %% {active, N} must be set to active > 12 to trigger the issue
 8533:     %% {active, 30} seems to trigger it quite often & reliably
 8534:     Role = get(role),
 8535:     ?P("[~w] set (initial) active: ~p", [Role, ActiveN]),
 8536:     inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8537:     ?P("[~w] spawn sender", [Role]),
 8538:     _Snd = spawn_link(
 8539:         fun Sender() ->
 8540:             case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Payload) of
 8541:                 ok ->
 8542:                     Sender();
 8543:                 {error, closed} ->
 8544:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Socket closed", [Role]),
 8545:                     exit(normal);
 8546:                 {error, Reason} ->
 8547:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Send failed: "
 8548:                        "~n      ~p", [Role, Reason]),
 8549:                     exit({send_failed, Reason})
 8550:             end
 8551:         end),
 8552:     ?P("[~w] begin recv", [Role]),
 8553:     recv(Socket, 0, 0, 0, Control, ActiveN).
 8554: 
 8555: recv(Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8556:     receive
 8557:         terminate ->
 8558:             ?P("[~w,recv] received terminate message when"
 8559:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8560:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8561:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8562:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8563:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8564:                [get(role),
 8565:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8566:                 Socket, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8567:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8568:             exit(normal);
 8569: 
 8570:         {tcp, Socket, Data} ->
 8571:             recv(Socket,
 8572:                  Total + byte_size(Data), TotIter + 1, TotAct,
 8573:                  Control, ActiveN);
 8574:         {tcp_passive, Socket} ->
 8575:             inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8576:             recv(Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct + 1, Control, ActiveN);
 8577:         {tcp_closed, Socket} ->
 8578:             ?P("[~w,recv] closed when"
 8579:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8580:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8581:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8582:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8583: 	       [get(role), Total, TotIter, TotAct, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8584: 	    ok;
 8585: 
 8586:         Other ->
 8587:             ?P("[~w,recv] received unexpected message"
 8588:                "~n      Msg:               ~p"
 8589:                "~n   when:"
 8590:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8591:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8592:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8593:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8594:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8595:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8596:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8597:                [get(role),
 8598:                 Other,
 8599:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8600:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8601:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8602:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8603:             Control ! {error, Socket, Other}
 8604: 
 8605:     after 2000 ->
 8606:             %% no data received in 2 seconds => test failed
 8607:             ?P("[~w,recv timeout] received nothing when:"
 8608:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8609:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8610:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8611:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8612:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8613:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8614:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8615:                [get(role),
 8616:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8617:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8618:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8619:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8620:             Control ! {timeout, Socket, Total}
 8621:     end.
 8622: 
 8623: 
 8624: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8625: 
 8626: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8627: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8628: %% monitors to it...
 8629: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8630:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8631:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8632:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8633:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8634:                             Addr;
 8635:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8636:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8637:                     end
 8638:            end,
 8639:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) end,
 8640:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8641:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8642: 
 8643: do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) ->
 8644:     ?P("begin"),
 8645:     Self         = self(),
 8646:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8647:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8648:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8649:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8650: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8651: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8652: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8653: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8654: 	 end,
 8655:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8656:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8657:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8658:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8659:     ?P("close socket"),
 8660:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8661:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8662:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8663:     ?P("done"),
 8664:     ok.
 8665: 
 8666: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8667:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8668: 
 8669: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8670:     receive
 8671: 	{'DOWN', ExpMon, ExpType, ExpSock, _Info} = Msg ->
 8672: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8673: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Msg]),
 8674: 	    exit(ok);
 8675: 
 8676: 	Any ->
 8677:             ExpMsg = {'DOWN', ExpMon, ExpType, ExpSock, '_Info'},
 8678: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8679: 	       "~n   ~p, Expected:"
 8680:                "~n   ~p", [Name, Any, ExpMsg]),
 8681: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any, ExpMsg})
 8682:     end.
 8683: 
 8684: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 8685:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 8686: 
 8687: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 8688:     receive
 8689: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 8690: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 8691:     end.
 8692: 
 8693: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 8694:     receive
 8695: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 8696: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 8697: 	    ok;
 8698: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 8699: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 8700: 	       "~n   ~p, Expected:"
 8701:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes, ExpRes]),
 8702: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes, ExpRes})
 8703:     end.
 8704: 
 8705: 
 8706: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8707: 
 8708: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8709: %% We create "many" listen socket(s), then spawns processes that create
 8710: %% monitors to them...
 8711: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8712:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8713:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8714:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8715:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8716:                             Addr;
 8717:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8718:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8719:                     end
 8720:            end,
 8721:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 8722:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8723:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8724: 
 8725: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 8726:     ?P("begin"),
 8727:     Self         = self(),
 8728:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8729:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 8730:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8731:     {ok, LSock2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8732:     {ok, LSock3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8733:     {ok, LSock4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8734:     {ok, LSock5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8735:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8736:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 8737: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 8738: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 8739: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 8740: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8741: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 8742: 	 end,
 8743:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8744:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([LSock1, LSock2, LSock3, LSock4, LSock5], F1),
 8745:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8746:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8747:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 8748:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8749:     gen_tcp:close(LSock2),
 8750:     gen_tcp:close(LSock3),
 8751:     gen_tcp:close(LSock4),
 8752:     gen_tcp:close(LSock5),
 8753:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8754:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8755:     ?P("done"),
 8756:     ok.
 8757: 
 8758: 
 8759: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 8760:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 8761: 
 8762: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 8763:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 8764:     exit(ok);
 8765: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 8766:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 8767:     receive
 8768: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 8769: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8770: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8771: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8772: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8773: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8774: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 8775: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 8776: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 8777: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 8778: 		{value, Value} ->
 8779: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 8780: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 8781: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 8782: 		false ->
 8783: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 8784: 	    end
 8785:     end.
 8786: 
 8787: 
 8788: 
 8789: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8790: 
 8791: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8792: %% We create a listen socket, then spawn client process(es) that create
 8793: %% monitors to it...
 8794: socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8795:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8796:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8797:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8798:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8799:                             Addr;
 8800:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8801:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8802:                     end
 8803:            end,
 8804:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config, Addr) end,
 8805:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8806:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8807: 
 8808: do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config, Addr) ->
 8809:     ?P("begin"),
 8810:     Self         = self(),
 8811:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8812:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8813:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 8814: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 8815: 	 end,
 8816:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 8817: 		 ?P("[~s] monitor socket", [Name]),
 8818: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8819: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8820: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8821: 	 end,
 8822:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 8823:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1, "client1"),
 8824:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(LSock1, F1, "client2"),
 8825:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(LSock1, F1, "client3"),
 8826:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(LSock1, F1, "client4"),
 8827:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(LSock1, F1, "client5"),
 8828:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 8829:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 8830:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 8831:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 8832:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 8833:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 8834:     ?P("close socket"),
 8835:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8836:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 8837:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8838:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 8839:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 8840:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 8841:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 8842:     ?P("done"),
 8843:     ok.
 8844: 
 8845: 
 8846: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8847: 
 8848: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8849: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8850: %% monitors to it...
 8851: socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8852:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8853:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8854:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8855:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8856:                             Addr;
 8857:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8858:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8859:                     end
 8860:            end,
 8861:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config, Addr) end,
 8862:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8863:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8864: 
 8865: do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config, Addr) ->
 8866:     ?P("begin"),
 8867:     Self         = self(),
 8868:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8869:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8870:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8871:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8872: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8873: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8874: 		 ?P("[client] sleep some"),
 8875: 		 ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8876: 		 ?P("[client] cancel (socket) monitor"),
 8877: 		 inet:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 8878: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 8879: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8880: 		 sm_await_no_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8881: 	 end,
 8882:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8883:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8884:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8885:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8886:     ?P("close socket"),
 8887:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8888:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8889:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8890:     ?P("done"),
 8891:     ok.
 8892: 
 8893: 
 8894: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8895:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8896: 
 8897: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8898:     receive
 8899: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 8900: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 8901: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 8902: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 8903: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8904: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8905: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8906: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8907: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 8908: 
 8909: 	Any ->
 8910: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8911: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 8912: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 8913: 
 8914:     after 1000 ->
 8915: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 8916: 	    exit(ok)
 8917:     end.
 8918: 
 8919: 
 8920: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8921: 
 8922: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8923: %% Spawn a process that creates a (listen) socket, then spawns processes
 8924: %% that create monitors to it...
 8925: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8926:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8927:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8928:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8929:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8930:                             Addr;
 8931:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8932:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8933:                     end
 8934:            end,
 8935:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) end,
 8936:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8937:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8938: 
 8939: do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) ->
 8940:     ?P("begin"),
 8941:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8942:     Self         = self(),
 8943:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 8944: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 8945: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 8946: 			      {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8947: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket to ctrl"),
 8948: 			      Self ! {socket, L},
 8949: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 8950: 			      receive
 8951: 				  {Self, die} ->
 8952: 				      exit(normal)
 8953: 			      end
 8954: 		      end),
 8955:     LSock1 = receive
 8956: 		 {socket, L} ->
 8957: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 8958: 		     L;
 8959: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 8960: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 8961: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 8962: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 8963: 	     end,
 8964:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8965:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8966: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8967: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8968: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8969: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8970: 	 end,
 8971:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8972:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8973:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8974:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8975:     ?P("kill owner"),
 8976:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 8977:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 8978:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 8979:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8980:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8981:     ?P("done"),
 8982:     ok.
 8983: 
 8984: 
 8985: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8986: 
 8987: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8988: %% Spawn a process that creates "many" (listen) socket(s), then spawns
 8989: %% a process that create monitors to them...
 8990: 
 8991: socket_monitor2_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8992:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8993:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8994:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8995:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8996:                             Addr;
 8997:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8998:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8999:                     end
 9000:            end,
 9001:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 9002:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9003:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9004: 
 9005: do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 9006:     ?P("begin"),
 9007:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9008:     Self         = self(),
 9009:     ?P("spawn owner"),
 9010:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9011: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9012: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 9013: 			      {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9014: 			      {ok, L2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9015: 			      {ok, L3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9016: 			      {ok, L4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9017: 			      {ok, L5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9018: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket(s) to ctrl"),
 9019: 			      Self ! {socket, [L1, L2, L3, L4, L5]},
 9020: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 9021: 			      receive
 9022: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9023: 				      exit(normal)
 9024: 			      end
 9025: 		      end),
 9026:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),
 9027:     LSocks = receive
 9028: 		 {socket, Socks} ->
 9029: 		     ?P("received socket(s) from owner"),
 9030: 		     Socks;
 9031: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9032: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 9033: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9034: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9035: 	     end,
 9036:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 9037:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 9038: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 9039: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 9040: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 9041: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 9042: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9043: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 9044: 	 end,
 9045:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9046:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSocks, F1),
 9047:     ?P("await client ready"),
 9048:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9049:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9050:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9051:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 9052:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9053:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9054:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9055:     ?P("done"),
 9056:     ok.
 9057:

 9061: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9062: %% Spawn a process that creates a (listen) socket, then spawns (client)
 9063: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 9064: socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9065:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9066:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9067:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9068:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9069:                             Addr;
 9070:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9071:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9072:                     end
 9073:            end,
 9074:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config, Addr) end,
 9075:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9076:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9077: 
 9078: do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config, Addr) ->
 9079:     ?P("begin"),
 9080:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9081:     Self         = self(),
 9082:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9083: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9084: 			      {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9085: 			      Self ! {socket, L},
 9086: 			      receive
 9087: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9088: 				      exit(normal)
 9089: 			      end
 9090: 		      end),
 9091:     LSock1 = receive
 9092: 		 {socket, L} ->
 9093: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 9094: 		     L;
 9095: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9096: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 9097: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9098: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9099: 	     end,
 9100:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 9101: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 9102: 	 end,
 9103:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 9104: 		 ?P("[~s] create monitor", [Name]),
 9105: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 9106: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9107: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type, Name)
 9108: 	 end,
 9109:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 9110:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1, "client1"),
 9111:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(LSock1, F1, "client2"),
 9112:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(LSock1, F1, "client3"),
 9113:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(LSock1, F1, "client4"),
 9114:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(LSock1, F1, "client5"),
 9115:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 9116:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 9117:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 9118:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 9119:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 9120:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 9121:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9122:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9123:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 9124:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9125:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 9126:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9127:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 9128:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 9129:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 9130:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 9131:     ?P("done"),
 9132:     ok.

 9137: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9138: %% Spawn a process that creates a (listen) socket, then spawns (client)
 9139: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 9140: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9141:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9142:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9143:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9144:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9145:                             Addr;
 9146:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9147:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9148:                     end
 9149:            end,
 9150:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) end,
 9151:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9152:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9153: 
 9154: do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) ->
 9155:     ?P("begin"),
 9156: 
 9157:     Self = self(),
 9158: 
 9159:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9160:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9161: 
 9162:     ?P("try get (created) listen socket info"),
 9163:     try inet:info(L) of
 9164: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 9165: 	    ?P("(created) Listen socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 9166: 	OBadInfo ->
 9167: 	    ?P("(created) listen socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 9168: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9169: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 9170:     catch
 9171: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 9172: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) listen socket info: "
 9173: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9174: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9175: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 9176: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9177: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 9178:     end,
 9179: 
 9180:     ?P("try close (listen) socket"),
 9181:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 9182: 
 9183:     ?P("try get (closed) listen socket info"),
 9184:     try inet:info(L) of
 9185: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 9186: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9187: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9188: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 9189: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9190: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9191: 	CBadInfo ->
 9192: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 9193: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 9194:     catch
 9195: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 9196: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) listen socket info: "
 9197: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9198: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9199: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 9200: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9201: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 9202:     end,
 9203: 
 9204:     ?P("done"),
 9205:     ok.
 9206: 
 9207: 
 9208: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9209: 
 9210: %% Check that we can connect with the option 'bind_to_device'
 9211: %% and the inet_backend option set to socket.
 9212: %% The value types *where* mutually exclusive:
 9213: %% prim_inet: binary()
 9214: %% socket:    string()
 9215: otp_18357(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9216:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 9217:     Cond = fun() ->
 9218:                    is_socket_supported(),
 9219:                    has_support_sock_bindtodevice()
 9220:            end,
 9221:     Pre  = fun() ->
 9222:                    case ?LIB:which_local_host_info(inet) of
 9223:                        {ok, [#{name := Name, addr := Addr}|_]} ->
 9224:                            ?P("~w:pre -> local host info:"
 9225:                               "~n   (IF) Name: ~p"
 9226:                               "~n   (IF) Addr: ~p",
 9227:                               [?FUNCTION_NAME, Name, Addr]),
 9228:                            #{name => Name, addr => Addr};
 9229:                        {error, Reason} ->
 9230:                            {skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Reason])}
 9231:                    end
 9232:            end,
 9233:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18357(State) end,
 9234:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9235:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 9236: 
 9237: do_otp_18357(#{name := Name, addr := Addr}) ->
 9238:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9239:     {ok, L}      = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ifaddr, Addr}]),
 9240:     {ok, PortNo} = inet:port(L),
 9241: 
 9242:     ?P("try connect (with bind-to-device)"),
 9243:     C = case gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNo,
 9244:                              [{inet_backend,   socket},
 9245:                               {bind_to_device, list_to_binary(Name)}]) of
 9246:             {ok, CSock} ->
 9247:                 CSock;
 9248:             {error, eperm = Reason} ->
 9249:                 ?P("Failed connecting, ~p, skipping", [Reason]),
 9250:                 (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9251:                 skip(Reason)
 9252:         end,
 9253: 
 9254:     ?P("try accept"),
 9255:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 9256: 
 9257:     ?P("cleanup"),
 9258:     (catch gen_tcp:close(C)),
 9259:     (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
 9260:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9261: 
 9262:     ?P("done"),
 9263:     ok.
 9264: 
 9265:

 9267: 
 9268: otp_18883(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9269:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(10)),
 9270:     Cond = fun() ->
 9271:                    is_socket_supported(),
 9272:                    is_linux()
 9273:            end,
 9274:     Pre  = fun() -> undefined end,
 9275:     Case = fun(_) -> do_otp_18883() end,
 9276:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9277:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 9278: 
 9279: do_otp_18883() ->
 9280:     Opts = [{inet_backend, socket},
 9281:             {debug, true},
 9282:             {active, false},
 9283:             {reuseaddr, true},
 9284:             {raw, 1, 15, <<1:32/native>>}],
 9285:     
 9286:     ?P("Create first listen socket"),
 9287:     {ok, L1}   = gen_tcp:listen(0, Opts),
 9288:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L1),
 9289: 
 9290:     ?P("Create second listen socket with the same port number as first: ~w",
 9291:        [Port]),
 9292:     {ok, L2}   = gen_tcp:listen(Port, Opts),
 9293: 
 9294:     ?P("success - cleanup"),
 9295:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L1)),
 9296:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L2)),
 9297: 
 9298:     ?P("done"),
 9299:     ok.

 9302: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9303: 
 9304: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9305: otp_18707(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9306:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9307:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9308:             fun() ->
 9309:                     %% We are not actually trying to make a connection...
 9310:                     is_socket_supported(),
 9311:                     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
 9312:                         true ->
 9313:                             case ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config) of
 9314:                                 socket ->
 9315:                                     ok;
 9316:                                 Backend ->
 9317:                                     ?SKIPT({backend, Backend})
 9318:                             end;
 9319:                         _ ->
 9320:                             ok
 9321:                     end
 9322:             end,
 9323:             fun() -> do_otp_18707(Config) end).
 9324: 
 9325: do_otp_18707(_Config) ->
 9326:     ?P("begin"),
 9327: 
 9328:     try gen_tcp:connect(#{port   => 80,
 9329:                           addr   => {127, 0, 0, 1},
 9330:                           family => inet},
 9331:                         [{inet_backend, socket}]) of
 9332:         {ok, Sock} ->
 9333:             %% Since we do not know what is going on
 9334:             %% on the machines we run the tests, this
 9335:             %% call "might" actually succeed...
 9336:             ?P("(expected) connect success"),
 9337:             gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 9338:             ok;
 9339:         {error, _Reason} ->
 9340:             ?P("expected failure: "
 9341:                "~n   ~p", [_Reason]),
 9342:             ok
 9343:     catch
 9344:         C:E:S ->
 9345:             ?P("unexpected failure: "
 9346:                "~n   C: ~p"
 9347:                "~n   E: ~p"
 9348:                "~n   S: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 9349:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, C, E, S})
 9350:     end,
 9351: 
 9352:     ?P("done"),
 9353:     ok.
 9354: 
 9355: 
 9356: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9357: 
 9358: is_windows() ->
 9359:     case os:type() of
 9360:         {win32, nt} ->
 9361:             true;
 9362:         _ ->
 9363:             false
 9364:     end.
 9365: 
 9366: is_linux() ->
 9367:     is_unix(linux, "Linux").
 9368: 
 9369: is_unix(Name, PlatformStr) ->
 9370:     is_platform(unix, Name, PlatformStr).
 9371: 
 9372: is_platform(Family, Name, PlatformStr)
 9373:   when is_atom(Family) andalso
 9374:        is_atom(Name) andalso
 9375:        is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 9376:     case os:type() of
 9377:         {Family, Name} ->
 9378:             ok;
 9379:         _ ->
 9380:             skip("Require " ++ PlatformStr)
 9381:     end.
 9382:   
 9383: 
 9384: is_socket_supported() ->
 9385:     try socket:info() of
 9386:         #{} ->
 9387:             ok
 9388:     catch
 9389:         error : notsup ->
 9390:             skip("esock not supported");
 9391:         error : undef ->
 9392:             skip("esock not configured")
 9393:     end.
 9394: 
 9395: has_support_sock_priority() ->
 9396:     has_support_socket_option_sock(priority).
 9397: 
 9398: has_support_sock_bindtodevice() ->
 9399:     has_support_socket_option_sock(bindtodevice).
 9400: 
 9401: has_support_socket_option_sock(Opt) ->
 9402:     has_support_socket_option(socket, Opt).
 9403: 
 9404: has_support_socket_option(Level, Option) ->
 9405:     case socket:is_supported(options, Level, Option) of
 9406:         true ->
 9407:             ok;
 9408:         false ->
 9409:             skip(?F("Not Supported: ~w option ~w", [Level, Option]))
 9410:     end.
 9411: 
 9412: 
 9413: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9414: 
 9415: skip(Reason) ->
 9416:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 9417: 
 9418: 
 9419: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9420: 
 9421: messages() ->
 9422:     pi(messages).
 9423: 
 9424: links() ->
 9425:     pi(links).
 9426: 
 9427: monitors() ->
 9428:     pi(monitors).
 9429: 
 9430: pi(Pid) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 9431:     process_info(Pid);
 9432: 
 9433: pi(Item) ->
 9434:     pi(self(), Item).
 9435: 
 9436: pi(Pid, Item) ->
 9437:     {Item, Val} = process_info(Pid, Item),
 9438:     Val.    
 9439:

 9443: send_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9444:     ?F("Send failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9445: 
 9446: connect_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9447:     ?F("Connect failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9448: 
 9449: listen_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9450:     ?F("Listen failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9451: 
 9452: accept_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9453:     ?F("Accept failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9454: 
 9455: port_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9456:     ?F("Port failed: ~w", [Reason]).
